name: First and Last Letter's the Same 2 Quiz | Humanities | 20 Questions

questions.text:
The hints shows the number of letters in the answer, as well as the letter that both begins and ends the answer.

What is a word that means a pleasant smell?  Five letters, first and last letter is A.
questions.explanation:
Aroma.

	Aroma is a word that comes from the Greek word meaning spice.  It is used commonly to denote a pleasant fragrance, such as the aroma of stewed lamb with herbs (sounds like a delightful aroma, does it not?).

questions.text: Which tree, native to Madagascar, mainland Africa, and Australia, is also called the bottle tree?  Six letters, first and last letter is B.
questions.explanation:
Baobab & Boab.

	The baobab is from the genus adansonia, which comprises of eight baobab species.  The tree goes by many names, including the boaboa, tabaldi, and monkey bread tree.

questions.text: H2CO3 is more commonly known as what kind of acid?  Eight letters, first and last letter is C.
questions.explanation:
Carbonic.

	When carbon dioxide, or CO2, dissolves in H2O (commonly known as water), a new compound is created.  This is H2CO3, which is known as carbonic acid.  This weak acid creates carbonate and bicarbonate salts.

questions.text: What word is both a brand of smartphone as well as the word that describes C3PO and R2D2?  Five letters, first and last letter is D.
questions.explanation:
Droid.

	Droid is kind of smartphone created by Motorola.  See Threepio (known more commonly as C3PO) and Artoo Detoo (known by the abbreviated term R2D2) are two well-known droids that appear in all six of the two original "Star Wars" movie trilogies.

questions.text: What pouch do you put a letter to a friend inside to mail it?  Eight letters, first and last letter is E.
questions.explanation:
Envelope.

	Envelopes come in many sizes and varieties.  There are kinds specifically designed for letters, some specifically for postcards, and still others for cash and checks.  There are also manila envelopes for important documents that cannot be folded.

questions.text: What is it called when something cannot possibly go wrong?  Nine letters, first and last letter is F.
questions.explanation:
Foolproof.

	When it seems impossible for something to go wrong, it is considered foolproof.  Of course, sometimes, no matter how "foolproof", one can find a way to completely mess up (believe me, I speak from experience). For instance, a child safety lock might be considered foolproof.  Of course, that does not mean I can always get the darn things open.  ;)

questions.text: Which creature can also sometimes be called a woodchuck?  Nine letters, first and last letter is G.
questions.explanation:
Groundhog.

	The woodchuck, or groundhog, is a rodent that belongs to the marmot family.  It can also be called the whistle-pig or land-beaver.  A famous groundhog, Punxsutawney Phil, supposedly foretells how much longer winter will last in February.

questions.text: A type of fabric that is made of broken checks, or other abstract, usually black and white patterns, is known as what?  Eleven letters, first and last letter is H.
questions.explanation:
Houndstooth.

	Houndstooth is a fabric that is a form of tessellation.  The most common form of "tessellation" is that of a beehive.  A continuing exact pattern that never overlaps.  Houndstooth is one of these types of geometric design.  It can also be called hound's tooth, houndstooth check, dogstooth, dogtooth (and myriads of other spelling variations).  There is also a smaller version of the pattern known as puppytooth.

questions.text: The bearberry is often referred to as what word, which is also used as a smoking product?  Twelve letters, first and last letter is K.
questions.explanation:
Kinnikinnick & Kinnikinick.

	Kinnikinnick is a common name given to the bearberries, flowering shrubs with red berries.  It is also spelled as kinnikinnic, kinnikinick, as well as various other spellings.  The plant appears to be safe, and is used in medicines, teas, and various other uses, but large doses of it can cause some sicknesses.

questions.text: What is another word meaning lawful?  Five letters, first and last letter is L.
questions.explanation:
Legal.

	If something is legal, it is accepted by the law.  Of course, if it is not accepted by the law, it is the opposite: illegal, or unlawful.

questions.text: What do you call a building that holds a tomb (or tombs), such as the Taj Mahal?  Nine letters, first and last letter is M.
questions.explanation:
Mausoleum.

	A mausoleum is a building that acts as a monument for a deceased person (or persons, perhaps).  The Taj Mahal is the world's most well-known (and most photographed) mausoleum, commissioned by Shah Jahan as a memorial tomb for his third wife, Mumtaz Mahal.

questions.text: What is a word that means twelve o'clock, assuming it is twelve hours past midnight?  Four letters, first and last letter is N.
questions.explanation:
Noon.

	Noon is the time when it is 12:00 during the day.  It is often a topic of discussion as to whether noon is 12:00 am or pm; is it the last minute of the morning (am) or is it the first minute of the afternoon (pm)?  Hmmm, whatever the case, one minute later is 12:01pm.

questions.text: Skipping O and going to P.  In motorsports, what is the act of vehicles slowing down for refueling?  Seven letters, first and last letter is P.
questions.explanation:
Pitstop.

	When watching NASCAR, perhaps you've noticed vehicles stopping in the rest area, where they can get repairs, new tires, and more gas for the race.  This area is known as the pit.  The act of stopping in this pit is called a pitstop (oftentimes written as two words).  Thank you so much to spanishliz for correctly defining "pitstop" for me.

questions.text: What is a word that means a waterway or stream?  Five letters, first and last letter is R.
questions.explanation:
River.

	A river is a type of waterway; one that flows, crossing to other rivers, tributaries, and streams.  Most rivers usually end up flowing to the ocean, through a series of connected waterways.

questions.text: If you are selling t-shirts, and have more than what you can sell, what word describes the excess that you have?  Seven letters, first and last letter is S.
questions.explanation:
Surplus.

	If you have more than you can possibly sell, you are known to have a surplus of t-shirts.  In fact, anything that is extra after meeting a certain requirement is known as surplus (I needed 200 quizzes online for a badge, but, as this is my 384th quiz, I have a surplus of 184).

questions.text: A quality or characteristic of someone can be called what?  Five letters, first and last letter is T.
questions.explanation:
Trait.

	Everybody has many traits; whether they are good or bad.  If someone is a very sweet, kind-hearted person, that "niceness" is a personality trait.  Of course, the number of traits one can have is endless.

questions.text: What is another term for a two-toed sloth?  Four letters, first and last letter is U.
questions.explanation:
Unau.

	There are many different kinds of sloths, including two-toed and three-toed sloths.  The three-toed sloths are known as ais, whereas the two-toed sloths are called unaus.  Perhaps, though, it's easier to call them three-toed and two-toed; much easier to remember that way.

questions.text: We are going to skip V.  What is the name of a small pushcart that is often used to transport dirt and other goods while gardening?  Eleven letters, first and last letter is W.
questions.explanation:
Wheelbarrow.

	Wheelbarrows are very commonly found in many people's sheds or garages.  They help transport large loads across a yard that would be very difficult to transport without the aid of the pushcart.  Oftentimes, a wheelbarrow has one wheel and two stands.  Lifting the stands allows the wheelbarrow to be pushed around.

questions.text: Skipping X, as it is such a difficult letter to use.  Which of these is another word for annual?  Six letters, first and last letter is Y.
questions.explanation:
Yearly.

	If something is annual, it happens once a year, or yearly.  For instance, once a year we must pay taxes, get our license plates updated, and make New Years Resolutions.  These are annual, or yearly, things.  Plants, too, can be yearly, or annual.  If they grow only one year and die off after that, they are annual plants (yearly).

questions.text: What is the name of an ancient Jewish coin?  Three letters, first and last letter is Z.
questions.explanation:
Zuz.

	The zuz (plural is zuzzim) was an ancient Jewish coin made of silver.  Four zuzzim would equal a shekel (and also, four denarii or four drachmas would make a shekel).
